target.rawSql:
SELECT
  time,
  'RPM Spike: ' || rpm || ' @ ' || speed || ' km/h' AS text,
  'RPM Spike' AS tags
FROM car_metrics
WHERE rpm > 2500 AND speed < 40 AND $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time

SELECT
  time,
  'Torque Slip: ' || torque_slip || '% (Gear ' || actual_gear || ')' AS text,
  'Torque Slip' AS tags
FROM car_metrics
WHERE torque_slip > 10 AND $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time

targets.rawSql: SELECT speed FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT rpm FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT map_kpa FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT fuel_level FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT engine_load FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT throttle FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT battery_voltage FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT timing_adv FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;

panels.description: Engine RPM - Watch for sudden spikes during low speed acceleration

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  time AS "time",
  rpm AS "RPM"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: RPM

panels.description: Vehicle speed - Compare with RPM to spot transmission slip (RPM spikes without speed increase)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  time AS "time",
  speed AS "Speed"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Speed

panels.description: Throttle position - Shows driver input. RPM spike without throttle = transmission issue

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  time AS "time",
  throttle AS "Throttle"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Throttle

panels.description: Calculated gear from RPM/Speed ratio. Sudden changes or instability indicates transmission issues. Adjust the gear_ratio_factor (default 280) based on your car's final drive ratio.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  time AS "time",
  actual_gear AS "Gear"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Actual Gear (OBD)

panels.description: Engine load percentage - Drops during clutch slip or torque converter issues

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  time AS "time",
  engine_load AS "Engine Load"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Engine Load

panels.description: RPM to Speed ratio - Should be consistent in each gear. Spikes indicate transmission slip.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  time AS "time",
  CASE
    WHEN speed < 5 THEN NULL
    ELSE ROUND((rpm::numeric / NULLIF(speed, 0)), 1)
  END AS "RPM/Speed Ratio"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: RPM/Speed Ratio (Slip Indicator)

panels.description: Demanded vs Actual engine torque. Gap indicates transmission slip or clutch issues.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  time AS "time",
  demanded_torque AS "Demanded",
  actual_torque AS "Actual"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Torque (Demanded vs Actual)

panels.description: Torque slip = Demanded - Actual. Positive values indicate engine can't deliver demanded torque (transmission slip, clutch slip). Threshold >10% is concerning.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  time AS "time",
  torque_slip AS "Torque Slip"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC

panels.title: Torque Slip (Transmission Health)

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  time AS "time",
  speed AS "Speed"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC
SELECT coolant FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT intake_temp FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT map_kpa FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;
SELECT fuel_level FROM car_metrics ORDER BY time DESC LIMIT 1;

SELECT
  time AS "time",
  engine_load AS "Engine Load",
  throttle AS "Throttle"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT
  time AS "time",
  rpm AS "RPM"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT
  time AS "time",
  map_kpa AS "MAP (kPa)",
  battery_voltage * 10 AS "Battery (V x10)"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC

SELECT
  time AS "time",
  coolant AS "Coolant",
  intake_temp AS "Intake"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC
SELECT AVG(speed) AS avg_speed FROM car_metrics WHERE $__timeFilter(time);
SELECT AVG(rpm) AS avg_rpm FROM car_metrics WHERE $__timeFilter(time);

SELECT
  time AS "time",
  rpm / 80 AS "RPM (scaled)",
  speed AS "Speed",
  coolant AS "Coolant",
  intake_temp AS "Intake",
  throttle AS "Throttle",
  engine_load AS "Load",
  fuel_level AS "Fuel"
FROM car_metrics
WHERE $__timeFilter(time)
ORDER BY time ASC
